meanings.definition: Behaving in a foolish or silly manner.
meanings.sent1: He made a coxcombical attempt to juggle the oranges.
meanings.sent2: The clown's coxcombical antics always made the children laugh.
meanings.sent3: His coxcombical dance moves at the party were quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The coxcombical way he tried to fix the broken toy only made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The coxcombical puppy kept chasing its own tail in circles.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a showy or pretentious display of self-importance.
meanings.sent1: She wore a coxcombical hat adorned with feathers and sequins.
meanings.sent2: The peacock's coxcombical display of feathers impressed the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent3: His coxcombical speech about his achievements annoyed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The coxcombical car was covered in shiny chrome and gold accents.
meanings.sent5: The coxcombical mansion stood out with its grand pillars and elaborate decorations.

meanings.definition: A person who is vain or conceited in their appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She dismissed him as a coxcombical who cared only about his looks.
meanings.sent2: The coxcombical strut of the model on the runway caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The coxcombical spent hours in front of the mirror admiring himself.
meanings.sent4: The coxcombical's constant bragging about his possessions annoyed his friends.
meanings.sent5: The coxcombical's elaborate hairstyle drew curious glances from passersby.
